info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:48PM MDT until July 15 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM MDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL MEAGHER...NORTHWESTERN JUDITH BASIN...CHOUTEAU AND CASCADE COUNTIES... At 1247 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Brady to 22 miles south of Geyser, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 1229 pm 66 mph wind gust was reported near Ulm. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Fort Benton, Stanford, Belt, Geraldine, Fort Shaw, The Knees, Highwood, Black Eagle, Geyser, Fort Shaw, Carter, Neihart, Floweree, Eden, Stockett, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Shonkin, Loma and Ulm. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
